page.title: 05WELBURY CUSTOMS
page.content: When a wedding takes place the village children tie up the church gates to prevent the bridal couple from leaving until they have thrown money over the gates for them. A rhyme known in the area is:Tid,Mid, Mitheray,Carlin,Palm & Paste Egg Day.The origin of Carlin Sunday comes from a time of food shortage in the area.A ship arrived on the R.Tyne two sundays before Easter with a cargo of dried carlin peas, thus saving the population from starvation. They are eaten only on this particular day with sunday dinner.Many children dress up as ghosts on Halloween,and go around houses in groups saying "Trick or Treat".The opening meet of the Hurworth Hunt takes place at the Duke of Wellington on the 1st saturday in November, and the huntsmen partake of a glass of sherry before the hunt.
